column4: i installed ubuntu over the top of windows and when i reboot its giving me a corrupt win 32 system file message and will not start up anything. When i did the process again it acknowledges that ubuntu is installed
i dont know. I just put the cd in and followed the instructions ext 4 i think. does that sound right?
reboot with the windows cd in the drive and choose repair
well if you know the file name that it says it's corrupt you can try and find it on the net and then replace it while your in ubuntu it should mount ntfs as r/w
